ProblemÔÉÅ

class pyrit.problem.Problem(description: str, mesh: Mesh, shape_function: ShapeFunction, regions: Regions, materials: Materials, boundary_conditions: BdryCond, excitations: Excitations)ÔÉÅ

Bases: object

General representation of a problem.

A general, non-specified problem.

Parameters

  • description (str) ‚Äì A description of the problem

  • mesh (Mesh) ‚Äì A mesh object. See pyrit.mesh.

  • shape_function (ShapeFunction) ‚Äì A shape function object. See pyrit.shapefunction.

  • regions (Regions) ‚Äì A regions object. See pyrit.regions.

  • materials (Materials) ‚Äì A materials object. See pyrit.materials.

  • boundary_conditions (BdryCond) ‚Äì A boundary conditions object. See pyrit.bdrycond.

  • excitations (Excitations) ‚Äì An excitations object. See pyrit.excitation.

Methods

consistency_check

Check the consistency of the problem.

load

Load a problem.

save

Saves the problem instance.

solve_linear_system

Solve a system of linear equations.

Attributes

problem_identifier

Identifier for the __repr__ method.
problem_identifier: str = 'General problem'ÔÉÅ

Identifier for the __repr__ method.

solve_linear_system(rhs: Union[spmatrix, ndarray], solver: Optional[Union[str, Callable[[csr_matrix, csr_matrix], Tuple[ndarray, Dict[str, Any]]]]] = None, **kwargs) → Tuple[ndarray, Dict[str, Any]]ÔÉÅ

Solve a system of linear equations.

General method for solving a system of linear equations. The matrix and the right-hand-side (rhs) must be given. With solver, it can be determined how to solve the system. There are some predefined solvers. It can also be passed a function, if you want to provide your own solver. The signature has to be as defined.

Parameters

  • matrix (sparse.spmatrix) ‚Äì The system matrix.

  • rhs (Union[sparse.spmatrix, np.ndarray]) ‚Äì The right-hand-side vector

  • solver (Union[str, Callable[[sparse.csr_matrix, sparse.csr_matrix], Tuple[np.ndarray, Dict[str, Any]]]], optional) ‚Äì The used solver. In the case of a string, use one of the predefined solvers. In the case of a function, make sure that the signature is as expected. The function gets the system matrix as first argument and the right-hand-side as second argument. It must return the solution as first value and a dictionary with information as second value. Furthermore, the kwargs are passed to the function.

  • kwargs ‚Äì kwargs passed to the solver.

Returns

  • solution (np.ndarray) ‚Äì The solution of the system of linear equations.

  • info (Dict[str, Any]) ‚Äì A dictionary with information from the solver.

consistency_check()ÔÉÅ

Check the consistency of the problem.

It is checked if for every region there is a related material, boundary condition or excitation in the corresponding data structure.

save(path: Union[str, Path], ignore_attributes: Optional[List[str]] = None) → PathÔÉÅ

Saves the problem instance.

Parameters

  • path (Union[str, Path]) ‚Äì The path. If a string is given, it is converted to a Path object. The file ending can but must not be given. In any case it will be a .pkl file. See pickle doc for more information. If the path contains a non-existing folder, this folder will be created.

  • ignore_attributes (List[str], optional) ‚Äì A list of attributes that are not included in the saved file. By default, all attributes are included.

Returns

path ‚Äì The path that was used for opening the file.

Return type

Path

static load(path: Union[str, Path]) → ProblemÔÉÅ

Load a problem.

Parameters

path (Union[str, Path]) ‚Äì

The path. If a string is given, it is converted to a Path object. The file ending can but must not be given. In any case it will be a .pkl file. See pickle doc for more information.

Returns

problem ‚Äì A problem instance.

Return type

Problem
